H0.text: Ozone absorbs ultraviolet light, a process in the atmosphere that protects people from the ultraviolet rays in sunlight.

H1.text: Nitrogen reflects ultraviolet light, protecting people from ultraviolet rays in sunlight.

H2.text: Water vapor scatters ultraviolet light, which is the process in the atmosphere that protects people from the ultraviolet rays in sunlight.

H3.text: Carbon dioxide blocks ultraviolet light in the atmosphere, protecting people from the ultraviolet rays in sunlight.

A4.text: The ozone layer absorbs 97 to 99 percent of the Sun's medium-frequency ultraviolet light (from about 200 nm to 315 nm wavelength).

A5.text: UV-C, which is very harmful to all living things, is entirely screened out by a combination of dioxygen (< 200 nm) and ozone (> about 200 nm) by around 35 kilometres (115,000 ft) altitude.
